coursework

Class Ext2File

  • java.lang.Object
    • coursework.DataBlock
      • coursework.Ext2File

  • public class Ext2File
extends DataBlock
    Title: Ext2File This class represents a file within a given volume. For the ext2 filesystem, this class represents a file within the filesystem. This class is an extension of the DataBlock which provides further functionality for reading blocks and obtaining bytes.
    See Also:
    DataBlock

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ext2File(Volume vol, java.lang.String fileString)
      Constructor used to represent a file in the given volume.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ext2File

        public Ext2File(Volume vol,
                java.lang.String fileString)
        Constructor used to represent a file in the given volume. The file can then be read and output to the user and can also view important info.
        Parameters:
        vol - The volume represented by the file opened.
        fileString - The name of the file to open in the volume.

    • Method Detail

      • getDirBytes

        public byte[] getDirBytes(int iNodeNumber)
        Method to obtain an array containing the bytes in the current directory under consideration.
        Parameters:
        iNodeNumber - The iNode number which references the directory.
        Returns:
        The array of bytes in the current directory.

      • printFileContents

        public java.lang.String printFileContents(byte[] bytes)
        Simple method to print the contents of a file in ASCII format. A string is returned containing the full file contents.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The array of bytes containing file info to be
        Returns:
        The string of characters in the file.

      • readFile

        public byte[] readFile(long startByte,
                       long length)
        Method to read the file the user specified in the file string. The method will read bytes from startByte up to the length they provide. An array of bytes will be returned containing all bytes in the file.
        Parameters:
        startByte - The byte to start reading from in the file.
        length - The length of the file the user wishes to read in bytes.
        Returns:
        An array of bytes relevant to the file opened.

      • getCurDirectoryString

        public java.lang.String getCurDirectoryString()
        Method to obtain the current directory name under consideration as a string.
        Returns:
        The current directory name as a string.

      • openFile

        public boolean openFile()
        Method which attempts to open a file specified by the user in the fileString. If successful, the user will be notified the file was successfully opened.
        Returns:
        True if the file was successfully opened, false otherwise.
